citation.article-title: Methanohalophilus mahii gen. nov., sp. nov., a methylotrophic halophilic methanogen.

p.s: Description of Methanohalophilus mahii sp. nov.
Methanohalophilus mahii (mah’i. i. N. L. n. mahii of Mah, in honor of R. A. Mah for his noteworthy research history in the areas of anaerobic microbiology and methanogenic bacteria)
Morphology and colony characteristics are the same as those described above for the genus.
Temperature optimum, 35°C, no growth at temperatures above 45°C.
Source, anaerobic sediment from Great Salt Lake, Utah.
Trimethylamine, dimethylamine, methylamine, and methanol serve as substrates for growth and methanogenesis; hydrogen-carbon dioxide, formate, and acetate do not serve as substrates.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the deoxyribonucleic acid is 48.5 mol%, as determined by buoyant density.

No definite antigenic relationship occurs between type strain SLP and members of the families Methanobacteriaceae, Methanomicrobiaceae, and Methanosarcinaceae as revealed by indirect immunofluorescence serotyping (Conway de Macario, personal communication).
The type strain is strain SLP (Salt Lake Paterek).
This strain has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection as strain ATCC 35705.
